definition: The ability to gather the public's views of proposed policy for consideration
The ability to formulate policy to implement devolved powers
The ability to define an object with value that will be registered with NICS
The ability to define the monetary value of a thing
The ability to manage something registered with NICS through its lifecycle from creation/identification to destruction/disposal
The ability to gather relevant information about an object registered with NICS
The ability to determine and manage risks associated with - or to - an object registered with NICS
The ablility to identify a citizen, or organisation, and maintain information on them and their interactions and with NICS
The ability to manage and track contact between NICS and citizens/organisations
The ablility to define and manage process that enables citizens/organisations to request an agreement or account
The ability to gather and process appeals submitted by citizens/organisations
The ability to conduct a study that reaches a conclusion and informs a decision
The ability to require corrective steps are taken to comply with an agreement or assessment
The ability to manage the creation, scheduling and delivery of information to the public
The ability to respond to citizens' questions
The ability to respond to Freedom of Information requests
The ability to respond to consultation requests from citizens, organisations or other public bodies
The ability to make data accessible to the general public
The ability to aggregate operational information, organised using common classifications and segmentations and disseminate this to the general public
The ability to provide and manage NICS's network infrastructure
The ability to provide and manage NICS's tools that enable staff members to communicate together
The ability to provide and manage NICS's tools that enable staff members to achieve common tasks more efficiently
The ability to provide and manage environments to run IT applications
The ability to provide and manage data storage repositories for use by IT applications and NICS staff
The ability to manage client devices that gather, process and transmit data to/from NICS services
The ability to provide and manage devices for use by NICS staff
The ability to manage users and applications, their roles and access permissions across NICS applications and services
The ability to manage security aspects of IT systems
The ability to mitigate against cyber threats to NICS
The ability to detect a breach in a NICS system or network
The ability of an IT system to present a human interface
The ability to gather and transport data around NICS's network
The ability to find, configure and turn on/off an application
The ability to perform digital processing
The ability to audit IT assets and inform interested parties when specified conditions arise
The ability to interface with any internet-connected device and perform processing on the device
The ability to ensure data is complete, consistent and can be inter-related so that it is useful and reliable
The ability to classify and maintain data reliably throughout its lifecycle
The ability to analyse data to gain insights and inform decisions
The ability to build or reuse software to meet a business need
The ability to publish and maintain information shared via websites
The ability to ensure a software solution performs as intended and meets various required standards
The ability to manage ICT landscape to ensure it is flexible to adapt to changing needs whilst maximising ROI to NICS
The ability to manage large scale IT work that spans multiple projects (and potentially multiple organisation units)
The ability to manage updates/changes being made within the IT systems
The ability to help users resolve IT issues
The ability to create products/services that deliver meaningful and relevant experiences to users
The ability to create visual artifacts (digital or otherwise) to convey a message to users
The ability to help others create human centered solutions that solve real problems for real people
The ability to schedule enough staff to provide a given business capability
The ability to manage vehicles
The ability to manage NICS staff work out of the office and 'in the field'
The ability to plan when work is done and by whom
The ability to trigger activities by a system/user executing a pre-determine process flow in order to realise a service.
The ability to manage and report on the progress of a service demand along its process flow
The ability to set targets for service delivery
The ability to monitor the actual performance of service delivery
The ability to provide visibility to others as to the actual performance against target performce for service delivery
The ablility to develop and maintain the strategic plan and overall direction of NICS
The ability to create materials that describe the need for change, expected benefits and costs
The ability to refine and get authorisation to proceed with a business case
The ability to engage the market to solicit services
The ability to consider reponses from market and select one to proceed with, if appropriate
The ability to agree the terms and conditions under which a vendor's services will be procured
The ability to manage a vendor's service delivery
The ability to manage NICS property and the resources available at each site
The ability to apply financial controls to NIS work
The ability to manage people in NICS such that they help deliver services efficiently and effectively
